titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 3425) to redesignate the Environmental Protection Agency as the Department of Environmental Protection, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-372, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3425 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Upon adoption of this resolution the Speaker may declare the declare the House resolved into the Committee of the Whole House for consideration of the bill. All points of order against consideration of the bill shall be waived. Measure will be read by section. Bill is closed to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Government Operations now printed in the bill. All points of order against the substitute shall be waived. No amendment to the substitute shall be in order except the amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution, to be offered in the order and manner specified in the report and not subject to further amendment. A...

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 123.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 191 - 227 (Roll no. 4).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/17/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3425 (redesignating the Environmental Protection Agency as the Department of Environmental Protection).
